intro: Setaria dasyura, commonly known as the rough beardgrass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted, hairy leaves and spikelets that bear small, pale brown seeds. The plant is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is often seen in disturbed areas such as roadsides and agricultural fields. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates. Setaria dasyura is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
